paragraphs.text: Armenia can't count on Russia any more.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: For Armenia, its role as a reliable partner and ally of Russia has never faced any real challenge
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Much of this reliance on Russia stems from essential security and economic concerns
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Armenia's security reliance on Russia is driven by a virtual state of war with neighbouring Azerbaijan, rooted in the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict, only exacerbated by the absence of "normal" diplomatic relations and closed border with Turkey
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And with the Turkish refusal to recognise the Armenian genocide, this threat perception is only magnified
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For small, landlocked Armenia, a strategic alliance with Russia is generally accepted as essential in the face of such inherent insecurity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And beyond an imperative of security, Armenia also depends on Russia as a crucial source of remittances, or money sent home by large numbers of Armenians living and working in Russia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: there is a surprisingly intense debate now under way within Armenia that seriously questions these fundamental pillars of the Armenian-Russian relationship
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: New challenge
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: More specifically, this new challenge to Armenia's traditional reliance on Russia is driven by two significant factors: tragedy and timing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A tragedy first triggered this turnabout
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when a rogue Russian soldier killed an entire Armenian family, save for a six-month-old infant
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: who later died of his stab wounds, in Gyumri, Armenia
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Gyumri is the country's second-largest city and the host of the Russian military base
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: That senseless act of random violence in the early morning hours of January 12, sparked an immediate and spontaneous outpouring of grief and mourning
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But the initial shock and grief quickly turned to outrage
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Russian military officials seemed to take charge of the case with a heavy-handed disdain and disregard for local sensitivities
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That perception was only deepened when Armenian officials were slow to respond or react
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It was this mishandling of the tragedy, even more than the murder itself, that then triggered a series of demonstrations and protests by local Armenians in Gyumri
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Fearing that the Russian conscript would be moved from his detention within the Russian base and likely returned to Moscow, local residents demanded that the self-confessed soldier be turned over to Armenian authorities
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Calming tensions
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: For its part, local Armenian officials and the prosecutor general scurried to calm tensions by first announcing that Armenian investigators were actively participating in the interrogation of the soldier, and then, once that did little to appease the protesters, vowed that the soldier would be tried in Armenia
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Amid the Armenian officials' wrangling over the legal process of the case, the absence of any higher level Armenian officials, and the failure of the Armenian president to declare a day of mourning or even make a statement, only escalated the tension
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And days later, no Armenian official attended the funeral of the murdered family
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: thereby triggering a fresh wave of indignant protests in the city, that later spread to the capital, Yerevan
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The protests soon moved to the Russian consulate in Gyumri before culminating in a march on the Russian base
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: as protesters broke through a police cordon to enter the base itself
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: there is a deeper context to this public anger
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In fact
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that family is only the latest victim in murders and shootings by Russian servicemen stationed at the Russian military base
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In 1999, two drunk Russian soldiers opened fire on a local market in the city, killing two and injuring dozens of others
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: And in 2013, two children were killed by unexploded ordnance on an unguarded tank firing range on the premises of the Russian base
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Bad timing
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Against this backdrop, the tragedy has also raised renewed questions of base security, with outrage that the armed soldier who reportedly deserted his post triggered no notice or alarm by Russian military personnel at the base
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Although this tragedy has prompted a new challenge to Armenian-Russian relations
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it is also exacerbated by a second factor, timing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The timing of this tragedy could not be much worse, for several reasons
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: First
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: in 2013, in what many perceived as Russian pressure on its so-called "strategic partner", Armenia was forced to scrap its planned free trade deal with the European Union in favour of joining the Russian-led Eurasian Union
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Second
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a steady supply of arms and advanced weapons systems to Azerbaijan from Russia has sowed further distrust
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And most recently, the negative impact on the Armenian economy from western sanctions imposed on Russia, evident in a sudden depreciation of the Armenian currency and reflected in a steep decline in remittances, has only revealed the asymmetry and lack of parity in Armenia's "partnership" with Russia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It seems clear that this unexpected challenge to Armenia's reliance on Russia will not dissipate any time soon
paragraphs.label: assumption
